reviews.review: Я готов играть в неё всегда!!!

One of the best plotlines and some involved gameplay.  Pretty brutal game, both in graphics and difficulty at times, but it's adjustable for casual gamers.  What we've come to expect from the 'Shock' series

What an awesome game, I was hesitant to play this before the original Bioshock, but then I just said fuck it, I want to play some good games that came out this year and this one did not disappoint. Great story, the shooting was solid, not too hard, a bit scary in parts. I've played a lot of amazing games this year and this one is right up there near the top. First game I've played since I got my 5850 years ago that made me think it's getting close to time for a new gpu, game looked amazing but in some of the frantic parts I could very noticeably see frame stuttering.

Play this.
Time traveling is just too dangerous. ...
Simply put,  flippin'-over-the-top-gaming-goodness with a gripping storyline!  A must play for all!
hope the new DLC will make it as good as the first one

Колумбия – парящий, город где развивается действие BioShock Infinite буквально окутывает нас красотой. Однако этот город так же полон и опасностей. Толпы обычных жителей будут атаковать главного героя – Букера Девитта, который пытается спасти молодую девушку Элизабет из этой клетки в облаках. Очень интересная часть игры которая абсолютно не относится к предыдущим двум частям игры. Однако в DLC Burial at Sea главный герой переноситься в Восторг - подводный городок из первых двух частей игры. DLC на мой взгляд такое же великолепное как и сам основной сюжет. Одним словом: ЭТО ШЕДЕВР!!!
Game of the year! Or even last few years.

LOVED this!
Also, maybe its's cuz I have aa 11 month old little girl now, but it's also the first game to make me cry at the end.

Впечатляющее сочетание экшена и драмы. Лучшее из тех, что мне доводилось видеть. Захватывает дух и не отпускат до финальных титров, и даже после вновь хочется вернуться назад, в Колумбию. Пожалуй, первая игра, на которую действительно было не жаль потраченных денег. Эта история обязательна к прохождению.

confusing as hell, but a truely amazing experience
9.5/10
Beautiful, gritty, poetic and action packed. One of the best written and best paced games iv ever played.

Deserves all the praise and  reputation that it got! All aspects of the game are outstanding; great visuals, fluid gameplay and captivating soundtrack. Another great game to add to your collection and if you have the first two games...well it is a must-buy...for the collection!

All I can say is WOW.
The gameplay is standard FPS with a few extras, you use the girl who travels with you to pick locks and pull aspects from other worlds into yours to help you- like ammo, cover, gun turrets and such.
The story is why you should play it is well written and entertaining ALL the way to the end.
I only had trouble in 3 or 4 places where I died and had to be revived to continue, and I played on the normal setting.
I have enjoyed all the Bioshock titles and must say this one is the best.
Their are a few areas that drag but not bad enough to ruin the game.
Absolutely great !
Einfach geiles spiel gute story und gameplay ist awesome

Excellent jeu , absolument magnifique . De superbe graphismes , un gameplay ahurissant, un scénario intelligent et complexe digne d'un roman de SF , Bioshock Infinite réunis tout ça pour former LE meilleur jeu de 2013 . En 2e place de mon podium a coté de Dishonored !

I was intrigued and excited to play this game. Somehow, Bioshock Infinite surpassed my expectations by miles. I got hooked on the story from the get go, having a blast with the opening levels, when you get to know the people of Columbia and their weird connection with the Vigors. The action ramps up and you stride towards meeting the strange, mysterious young woman that is Elizabeth… and then the adventure truly begins. This is a masterpiece, a work of genius. The writing is something to amaze at, next to the sound, music, voice acting, mo-cap, design, art, in-game architecture, and so on.

This Game was the best $13 I ever spent on steam!!
When this baby goes on sale again, I recommend buying it!!!
Exelente juego lleno de accion y con una buena historia, aunque los poderes son los mismos que de los juegos pasados con algunos agragados.
BEST ENDING EVER!!!!!!!!!!

I think I'm happy that I'm sad to have completed this game?!? 
But then I guess I never really had a choice?!?

I think I'll revisit the Shiny Happy People and co. but, this time, I'm gonna party like it's 1999!
Well... it is just bloody amazing !!!
unbelievable piece - art graphics with no compromises
Best story in a game and maybe my best game
Fast-paced and fun gunplay set in a beautiful world. A mind-blowing story surrounds two of the best developed central characters I have ever seen. Riding the sky-lines is exhilarating.
Altamente recomendável! Excelente história, gráficos e trilha sonora! Tem que prestar bastante atenção na narrativa do mundo pra entender completamente o jogo.
I am really enjoying this game. I like the story and love the look of it. I'm not quite done with my first play through and I definitely plan on playing it again when I am done.

In short, this game will get a full review from me, however I will endeavor to go into the details as to why. The game combines strong FPS mechanics, weapons, and Vigors with a strong environment giving the player a great deal of immersion. The best comparison I can draw with this game and another is Metro 2013, the game has a servicable main storyline, nothing spectacular and arguably inconsistent//self contradicting, but immerses the player with well concieved and beautiful environments where NPCs behave as you would expect them too, and the dialogue is superbly written. The side narratives in this game are the most interesting aspect of it, the stories of minor characters and the two conflicting populations will keep the player entralled. The music in this game is also quite well done, despite it being overshadowed by the visual spectacles and dialogue. With solid graphics, gamplay, audio and an unquestionable ability to immerse the player, Bioshock Infinite is a game which will appeal both to players looking for a strong FPS experiene as well as  a those looking for an immersive storytelling experience.
Отличная игра! Сюжет, графика, музыка на высоте... 10/10!
It's a good game but not a good bioshock game.

One of the most boring, overhyped shooters I have ever had the misfortune of buying and playing. The entire game is just style over substance (substance of any value that is) and is only worth it if you have similar values or rather low standards for First Person Shooters.

Давно хотел написать рекомендацию, но все забывал. Позор мне :) Ибо это самая лучшая игра в этом году. Да что там говорить - такие игры выходят очень редко и играть в них одно удовольствие. Мир здесь преподнесен во всех красках и каждый пройденный виртуальный метр по этому городу незабываем. Здесь нет зависимости у людей от тоников, но между тем показана проблемная тема - расизм и построенная на нем вера у людей :) Но все это ничего не значит, так как по ходу истории произойдет смешение реальностей и в центре всего оказывается девушка Элизабет, с которой также связано немало тайн, открывающихся по мере прохождения.

Настоятельно рекомендуется к прохождению на секретной сложности: 1999 год

Оценка: 100 из 10.

The System Shock games stand as great achievements in video game making. Both are complex and advanced for their time, not only in gameplay, but also in story and technology. This set the bar high for Bioshock, and despite some flaws, both 1 and 2 manage to stand out as solid games. Certainly not as expectional as SS2, but close enough to land them on most "must play" lists. With Infinite, another attempt was made at reaching that bar, and I believe it not only failed to reach it, but didn't even reach the level of its family in Rapture. For a game praised up and down for being polished, I found flaw in almost every system. The graphics are stunning, except for the low resolution textures, sky boxes and other backgrounds that abound (although not as badly as they do on the console versions). The attention to detail is excellent, if you ignore the fact that from no other levels can you see the Hall of Heroes, Battleship Bay, Comstock House, etc, Columbia is just a boring backdrop. The gunplay is state of the art, if you can come to terms with using some combination of the hand cannon, carbine and machine gun the entire game. The powers are fresh and interesting, if you like "hold the button to create a trap!". The game is difficult! I used those 3 weapons, no powers, didn't buy any food/ammo/etc from machines and didn't die a single time on hard. 1999 mode is supposed to be the answer to that, but it's locked from the start of the game. The story and characters are gripping and the best part! Oh my... Let's look back, remember in Bioshock, the last 1/3 or so of the game, after you do a little "office golfing"? Pretty forgettable, right? All of Infinite feels like that, with the exception of a few strong moments (Slate stands out). What little characterization the main characters have comes so slowly it's hard to care, and then to complicate things further, information found in the voxaphones (recordings) throughout the game is ignored 9/10 times, despite being in many cases much more interesting than the story the game is feeding you. Infinite tries so hard to show shades of grey, but instead almost every character and plot point feels cliched or under utilized. All that to say nothing of the last hour or so of the game, any good will built up is quickly destroyed with a lazy copout explanation (quantum physics, I ain't gotta explain shit!) and more plot holes than most fan fictions. The final moments feel like nothing more than an attempt to tie this game to older, better games, while leaving room for sequels and DLC (it'll come out eventually?). All that said though, Infinite is by no means a bad game, it's still one of the most fun and interesting games to come out this year. It is certainly not however the game that every ass kissing review and award makes it out to be. Pick it up, preferably on sale, and find out for yourself, but in my opinion, the much better (and cheaper) Bioshock 1 and System Shock 2 more deserving of your time and money.

Sehr schönes Spiel, die Athmosphäre ist klasse und zieht sich schön durch die wirklich großen Level. Man hat über die gesamte (überdurchschnittlich lange) Story spaß, da sich die Kämpfe abwechslungsreich gestalten und auch die Erzählung nicht langweiliger wird. Das Spiel schafft es auch, den Spannungsbogen bis zum Ende aufrecht zu erhalten.
Eine schöne Fortsetzung der ausergewöhnlich guten Bioshock Reihe, sogar mit kleinen Anspielungen auf den ersten Teil. Klare Kaufempfehlung!

I played in 1999 mode (unlock with konami code) which had good difficulty scaling without creating bullet sponges. The enviroments are very pretty and fun to play in. The whole America worship is entertaining for quite some time, though IMO it gets a tired later.

Fantástico! Ken Levine conseguiu superar até o primeiro Bioshock, um feito impressionante. A Jjgabilidade é sólida, com bastante ação. A parte técnica dos gráficos pode não impressionar, mas em compensação, a arte é fantástica! Não é nada difícil você se pegar parado simplesmente apreciando a paisagem. Mas o ponto alto mesmo, como no primeiro Bioshock, é a estória. Intrigante, nervosa, forte, até brutal em alguns momentos, mas muito, muito bem escrita. Bioshock Infinite é o tipo de jogo que deixa você "digerindo" o que aconteceu nos últimos 30 minutos por um bom tempo. Recomendadíssimo!

Um jogo ótimo. Gráficos lindos. Nunca achei tirar screenshots de um jogo tão necessário quanto esse Bioshock. 
Ótima jogabilidade, coisa que não eu não gostei muito no primeiro Bioshock.
História um pouco confusa, mas envolvente. Eu realmente torçi para que a fofa da Elisabeth fosse para Paris no final.

o enredo desse jogo é simplesmente demais, não só o enredo mas tudo sim tudo se encaixa perfeitamente, é só explorar bem o game que voce encontra gravações; em audio que enquementar bem a história, e presta atenção nos diálogos dos personagens...

Bioshock so far has largely been about the developement of a cool world with a very unique story about the creation of that world and how these establishments rise and fall. The first bioshock called heavily upon Ayn Rands works and nearly everyone who came to rapture became enthralled with it. Bioshock infinite continues this tradition faithfully although I am not sure what literary works (if any) Infinite calls upon to create columbia. There seems to be a big narrative on extreme nationalism as well as racial and class conflicts (specifically mirroring those in the United States about 100 years ago), although you still get the feeling that Irrational was treading a little too carefully on material that demands raw, unsettling truth. On the other hand there is this cool quantum conundrum going on that unfolds which is cool and culminates into one of the best endings to a video game I have ever seen. Now since it decides to play around with quantum mechanics, naturally a game company's story writers are going to get shit wrong, so it requires a little suspension of disbelief (something I would think gamers would be good at). As for the gameplay, well....it kinda blows. The gun play is reduced to one dimensional tactics of only having 2 weapons at a time (2 weapons that are usually bullet flingers), as opposed to the large array of fun diverse weapons in Bioshock 1 (and even the gunplay in that was kind of weak so you see my point). There also seems to be an overabundance of "press x to do y" rather than using the already existing gameplay mechanics to interact with the environment. The one gameplay mechanic that does feel pretty good is the skylines. It is pretty fluid and kind of over powered (which is a good thing). Overall you choose whether you think it is worth playing. I would still say I enjoyed it and the revelations toward the end make a second playthrough feel very different.

Dizzing, beautiful, and subtle creepy.. everything you've come to love in a Bioshock game. 

Best of all the first 6 months of bugs is over! So if like me your were waiting for the play to smoothout, it's here!

Fupping amazing, i mean holy fucking shit that is one goddamn awesome game from beggining to end

I am currently writing this recommendation just two hours after finishing the story of Bioshock: Infinite. And after two hours of thinking about what has happened I will admit, this is the first bioshock game that I have finished and I belive that it is a monument to how games should tell stories. Developers, take notes.  Most games aren't remembered for the stories because they are usually rubbish, but when they are worth your time, they are made to keep the player in awe, wonder, mysterym and suspence like Bioshock: Infinite . If I could relate this game to anything within popular culture, I would discribe the genious mind fuck to be similar to Fight Club, the atmosphere and gameplay keeps you on your toes like the Bourne Ultimatum, the imagary is as stunning as The Lord of the Rings, and the story is on par with Final Fantasy X and Inception. The constant worring of falling off of the floating cities, the integration of Bioshock 1 and Infinite is great for veteran and new plaers, and the sudden hostility toward your character at the beginning are just a couple great components of this game that makes this is one for the history books. Once you spiral into the world of Infinite, there is no goingback, but forward to know what happens next.

Spoilers*
This game is terrible in comparison to its predecessor. The two gun limit discourages experimentation, upgrading guns, and limits strategy so the devs had to make every encounter possible for any combination. Where as in the first and second game you could use eight different weapons to tackle a tough fight in a multitude of ways, from booby traps to full on assault or sneak attacks. 

The vigors which are this games plasmids have a total of 3 I actually used in combat with the others being fillers. Storywise it is never explained what they are made of, how they are made, and why does almost no one use them? In rapture they were a part of the world and its history and if you removed them the story would make no sense. In Columbia they are just there and could be removed with almost no impact, and obviously put in the game so that people could say "It has vigors which are like bioshocks plasmids!"

 Elizabeth who is your companion for almost the whole game has two major flaws that destroy her character
1.She has lived in isolation in a tower her entire life, only meeting a giant mechanical bird once in a while but she has the social skills of your average teen
2.She has a power to open a hole to ANYWHERE at ANY TIME and never uses this to escape said tower even though less than 10 minutes after meeting her it is clear she can travel through them.

Booker Dewitt is no genius either. At one point he sees a sign that clearly implies if you have a mark on your hand, expect harsh treatment. What does our hero do when he sees this mark on his hand? He just goes "huh" and leaves it in plain view which backfires on him no less than 5 minutes later, with him only covering it if his hand gets stabbed. On top of this he never shuts up, constantly talking and showing what the player is supposed to be feeling.

The plot makes no sense, where your character entered an alternate universe to get his daughter from himself to pay his debts, and ends with your omnipotent daughter killing you to prevent you from kidnapping her from yourself. Literally a paradox on top of misunderstanding the multiverse theory. 

The city you are in for the entire game ditched the idea of balloons holding them up for atoms being held up in space due to "quantum mechanics". Basically anything that could be questionable is dismissed by quantum mechanics, with almost no explanation other than that. The second antagonist of the game which is songbird, a giant metal bird, is one of the biggest disappointments in the game. Throughout the entire game he is heckling you and trying to take back elizabeth and eventually you would think you fight this monstrosity right? Wrong, you get to throw him at a blimp every five minutes in a survival battle against a bunch of mooks and then he dies through one of the BIGGEST ASSPULLS I HAVE SEEN.

Elizabeth using her new godlike powers, transports you and songbird into Rapture, and he drowns under the ocean. Thats it. One of the biggest obstacles in the game is killed through almost no player interaction.

Also on a slightly more sensitive matter, racism. The game tries to be mature by having blacks serve as low class workers for whites and generally being like the south before the civil war. But it never does use the N word, in fear of backlash even though it was used commonly back then. The game gives you a choice at one point to throw the first baseball at a interracial couple during a fair which COULD have been a good choice, to either sacrifice your morals to fit in, fight for whats right or be neutral, but no matter what you do, you are railroaded into fighting a bunch of cops only armed with nightsticks.

TL:DR its a over-hyped linear shooter with terrible mechanics, a hastily put together story, wasted potential and has no need for the bioshock title other than brand recognition because releasing this game on its own would have been to "risky"
If you think this game is good, playthrough the first bioshock game and then this one and compare gameplay differences and look at the story again

Possibly one of the best games I've ever played! Rich story line, beautiful graphics and the game play interaction with Elizabeth - I've not encountered a game with such an interesting combat addition before.
Playing Bioshock Infinite certainly felt like riding a roaller coaster through a madhouse. If that ain't a feat in itself, I know not what is....
Probably the best FPS of all time. Perfect in every department.

Достоинства:
+ Красивая картинка с вменяемыми требованиями к железу.
+ Интересный сюжет не отпускающий до конца, до последней мелочи проработанная атмосфера.
+ Напарник (Элизабет), который не раздражает своим присутствием, не путается под ногами, помогает патронами, химией и другими благами во время игры. Отлично проработаны эмоции, она как живая, ей хочется сопереживать.

Недостатки:
- Малое разнообразие врагов, скучноватые и однообразные перестрелки с ними.

BioShock Infinite takes gaming experience to a whole new level. Incredible gameplay, well-thought atmosphere and jaw-dropping storytelling. This is the game of the 21st century. There's virtually no downside or imperfection. 10/10.

9,8\10
Шедевр с любой стороны. Сюжет - идеальный. Геймплей захватывающий. Графика очень красочная. Впечатлений - море! Роль Элизабетт - восхитительна! Каждая ее эмоция, как настоящая. Единственый, маленький минус - нет русской озвучкой.
Рекомендую всем пройти эту игру. Вы не пожалеете потраченного времени на нее.
Easily the most impressive work of art undertaken by mankind thus far. Plus you get to kill racist people, which is something video games have been lacking.

Not gods gift to gaming as the hype would have you believe. Not incomprehensible. Just a nicely put together game that throws a whole load of questions into a series that already had enough of them. out of all of the bioshocks i like this one more than two but less than my first time playing one. I like it more than my consecutive playthroughs of one though so i'd give it a 9.5/10. it is definitely a nice looking game as well. grab yourself some screenshot wallpapers.

I cannot describe how perfect this game is. The characters are amazingly well written and portrayed (Elizabeth is a really lovable character) and the story is full of beautiful intricacies.
Columbia is a living, breathing world filled with the most engaging and breathtaking  sceneries, they come natural to you, you enjoy every detail that is thrown into your sight.
This is, without a doubt, one of the best games I've ever played. The gameplay is good, not excellent, but that doesn't stop me giving this title the top score.

 5 out of 5 stars. ★★★★★

Ein super geiles Spiel! Mega Hübsche Grafik und Leveldesign, SUPER Story, gut synchronisirt auf der deutschen Sprachebene,.... Dein spielbarer Charakter ist mega geil und einer der coolsten die es in einem Bioshock je gab ( meiner meinung nach).  Kämpfe sind actionreich aber auch nicht einfach zu beweltigen. Ein richtig geiles Spiel, Leute. 9/10

Get it.  Get it now.  Play it.  Play it more.  Then we can share stares of disbelief over the completely unexpected twists at the end.  Although the ending did leave me wanting a little bit more out of it in terms of answering a few questions, I was stunned at the outcome.  The visuals are gorgeous, the female sidekick is likeable and doesn't piss you off, and the story is engrosing.  Thoroughly enjoyed it.

Un chef d'oeuvre : une bande son a tomber, un gameplay pas parfait mais franchement pas dégueux (on regrette toutefois le fait de ne pouvoir porter que 2 armes...) et surtout un scénario épique avec un fin dantesque qui vous met sur le cul ! De plus le personnage d'Elizabeth est extrèmement bien foutu et le jeu ne serait rien sans elle !
Bref, un très très très bon jeu !

Semplicemente incredibile. Con Bioshock Infinite la famosissima serie raggiunge vette di qualità artistica e narrativa altissime.
Un must da avere e da giocare più e più volte!

8.5/10

This game is a masterpiece. Beautiful artstyle aside, it has great game feel, gameplay that complements the characters, great writing and a mind-boggling ending, which left me in front of my computer, staring at the screen. I may be a bit late, but if anyone has not had the honour to play this game yet, WHAT ARE YOU DOING READING THIS? GO PLAY THIS GAME!

Bought this when it was on sale for 11 bucks. What a deal! Great game. Its like fallout crossed with borderlands, with a little infamous thrown in there. Great single player fps, I recommend it. 

Its not 10/10 like the reviewers give this game, that's over rated for sure. But its at least a 8/10. Graphics, gameplay, story, fantasy world that lets you feel like youre really in the game. Its all here.
One of the best games ever made. Brilliant story and just an amazing adventure.
Very nice game.
Fantastic visuals, engrossing story and setting and enjoyable gameplay make this one of the best FPSs I've played.

Nem parece que passei quase 17 horas para terminar. Parece um longo filme com um final de dar nó no cérebro. Do jeito que gosto.
Mas nem todo filme escapa de alguns defeitos. A única coisa a reclamar são os momentos de tiroteio, onde você acaba se confundindo e literalmente não sabendo de onde você está sendo alvejado. Além de momentos em que você está atrás de uma caixa se protegendo e aparece alguém do nada atrás de você, tornando impossível sobreviver.

Porém o jogo inteiro, a Elizabeth, a história e os cenários compensam (e muito).
Valeu cada centavo.
Enormee jeux . Déchire sa race ! Scénario fou ! Un gameplay à te faire rester chez toute la journée ! Ce jeu mérite largement son 19/20
